text: Roy Charles Hammond (August 3, 1939 â€“ September 16, 2020), better known as Roy C or Roy "C", was an American southern soul singer-songwriter and record executive. He was best known for his songs "Shotgun Wedding" and "Impeach the President". He was born in Newington, Georgia. Hammond died on September 16, 2020 in Allendale, South Carolina from liver cancer at the age of 81. ==References== Category:1939 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Cancer deaths in South Carolina Category:Deaths from liver cancer Category:American singer-songwriters Category:American soul singers Category:American record producers Category:Singers from Georgia (U.S. state) Category:Writers from Georgia (U.S. state) Category:Businesspeople from Georgia (U.S. state)
title: Roy C
